content: Lifestyle Asked by Jessica Ann LeeAsked on 29 Aug 2019What sort of topics and answers in Seedly will gain the most likes? (translate- what are the popular topics people care about?)?Seems like most Singaporeans are not readily likes-givers haha!6 answersAnswerBump3
Answers (6)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Hariz Arthur Maloy, Independent Financial Advisor at Promiseland IndependentTop Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomUpdated on 30 Aug 2019Hey Jessica, saw some of your previous answers on other topics. Just gotta be consistent and ever-present. I've answered close to 800 questions now. Takes a lot of dedication and effort to keep it up. So keep answering without expecting likes and soon they'll come.2 comments4
Kenneth Lou30 Aug 2019Legend! :) Keep going!Gabriel Tham30 Aug 2019Upvote you so that we can see what's the final level naming

JWjiajing wangLevel 3. WonderkidUpdated on 30 Aug 2019I will put credit card benefits as #1 actually.. Nothing you can do with CPF coz government planned it quite well. The rest like  investments and bank accounts are quite often replied by the community too1 comment2
Kenneth Lou30 Aug 2019Credit card benefits are definitely a hot topic!
Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 30 Aug 2019CPF.How to invest.ILP and unit trusts.How to save money.3 comments2
See all 3 comments Kenneth Lou30 Aug 2019Haha CPF.Gabriel Tham30 Aug 2019I totally agree

Cedric Jamie Soh, Director at Seniorcare.com.sgTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterUpdated on 31 Aug 2019Just answer whatever questions pop up and that you do have knowledge about it. Just write like you are talking to a good friend, minus the technical stuff, talk plainly and sincerely.I find most direct answers will get thumbs up from appreciative readers.Sincerity is the greatest receiver of likes. (or go like carousell likes-for-likes... HAHAHAHAHA!)0 comments1

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 30 Aug 2019Hello Jessica! :)
Firstly a BIG WELCOME to the Seedly community platform!And this is a platform build for the longer term to really make a dent in the whole personal finance space here in Singapore (and one day the region) :)Hang around and I'm sure all of our fellow community members will start seeing your answers and also dropping upvotes along the way hahaha.Also, some small tips! Update your profile to include some bio or simple one-linerAdd your social linksShare your answers on your relevant feeds in your own circlesLastly, be ever-present on the platform and answer more people who need help :) super happy to have you on board once again!See you around and come for our meetups! (we will send out private meeting and meetup invites for Level 5 and above, so stay tuned and look out in your email)0 comments1

Alan KorLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 01 Sep 2019Could range from various topics like savings account, savings journey, loans, debt clearance, investment strategies, beginner investment knowledge etcThere are many personal finance topics out thereInformative answers which are given sincerely and without any advertisement for services are generally most likedBut there are a lot of insurance agents promoting their services here, trying to tap on the 16,000+ leads in Seedly, which is really a sad case for a good platform0 comments0
